result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lana V Grant

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lana V Grant in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
St - Plea to all 3 Cts as amended in 14CF1093; DRI 15CF182
Rights given
P - No Contest
BTC: Finding of guilt Cts 1, 2 & 3 in 14CF1093; DRI 15CF182.
Plea hearing on June 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Lana V Grant in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.  more discussion needed.  Adjourn until later this week  Status conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Lana V Grant in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Def - req plea date after Milwaukee case resolved  Plea hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Lana V Grant in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams for Matthew Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

CO-SIGNED BY FATHER HARRY GRANT W/PHOTO I.D.
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Lana V Grant in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
St - Req cash bond
Def - Waive reading; Req no more than $100 cash, father is present and willing to co-sign also
BTC: Vacate warrant. Bond set at $2,000 co-sig bond w/father, cond's same as 14CF1093; 14CF1093 - bond modified to $500 cash already posted plus $2,000 co-signed with father. Def to go to ZCI today.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Warrant forwarded to RCSD for entry.
